page.title: 02TOURISM
page.content:
The whole area is very scenic giving excellent views of Fowey,Polruan and St Austell Bay.The only sandy beach is Polridmouth which is accessible only on foot or by boat.The walks are well maintained and easy to follow with car parking at Menabilly Barton or the National Trust one beside Combe Farm. There are a few camping sites near by such as that at Penhale Farm. The Cornwall South Coast Path takes you all the way round the area and is well worth the walk.
{Gribbin Head-Tourism ____________________ From St Catherine's Castle to the Gribbin Beacon there is a coastal footpath walk of about 6 kilometres.It is part of the Cornwall Coastal Footpath and includes three sections of National Trust land.
